posts.content:
Hello everyone.

I was talking to a friend and we had an idea of a character, but we do not know if it works very well, so I wanted to ask the "creation masters" of the forum to help me in this task.

The idea is it would be a Druid with an animal companion Bear that would be buffed to be a tank, while the druid kills everyone. EVERYONE.

It would be to play PvM at first. Level Cap 30. I do not know which race gives the most advantages to the druids, elf? Druid main class, with no restrictions to complements. Melle, no. Ranged, yes. Weapons, I believe a bow. Spells, some buffs for the animal companion (preferably a Bear) and some good damage.

I believe that is it.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Just off the top of my head, I'd expect a Cleric/Druid's companion may provide the tankiness you'd need to pull this off... if at all.  Cleric simply has the best party buffs in the game and the only way to haste your pal without UMD.  Combined with Greater Magic Fang could become a decent damage-dealer if micromanaged properly.

You'll have two key problems. 

First, as has been established in a few other Arelith threads, your buffs will likely get dispelled.  Dunno if this applies to PvM but I am pointing out possible vulnerability nonetheless.

Secondly, animals can easily be feared.  When that happens, you'll lose your tank.  Cleric has Remove Fear which can be used both as a pre-buff to boost saves and also to restore back to status quo. You may also decide to supplement your meatwall with a high-level crit immune, fear immune summon... just in case.

A druid can buff the bear's attack with Bull's STR, it's DR and its claws' DR penetration with Stoneskin et al., AoV for combat boost and AC via Barkskin.  Cleric will contribute Endure for HP/Fort, Cat's DEX (with Animal) for AC, Haste (with Travel),  Bless/Aid/Prayer/Battletide for combat boost.

It would be a high WIS zen build according to your ranged preference.  Any need to melee would force it to be a finessed high DEX build instead.

It's not a bad synergy but the optimal split is problematic.  Then there's a monk skill dump (3 monk levels) to consider to throw another monkey wrench into the mix.  Expect to spend A LOT of time buffing with two sets of divine buffing available.

Then again, you could just build a pure Druid and accept the limitations.  Here's a link to the bear's level-up stats (outside of Arelith), just to give you an idea of its intrinsic potential.

I'll need to think more about the trade-offs.  In the meantime, you can do the same.   I'd expect human would be the best fit.  You can take Martial with the spare feat and be able to max another skill and avoid the HP/Fort loss.

Here's your level 15 bear pal unbuffed stats:

Str 30, Dex 13, Con 17, Int 3, Wis 12, Cha 6
HP 144, AC 16
AB +21/+16/+11
Dmg: 12-22 20x2 claw and 12-30 20x2 bite
Saves F/W/R: 12/6/10

Very poor Will save so use Cleric's Protection vs Evil & Protection vs Good against most fear aura.
For neutral dragons, use Owl's Insight + Owl's WIS + Remove Fear + Bless + Aid + Resistance to reach save of 19 vs fear.  Not horrible.
